instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPVCCIO_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCIO_S0_CPU? PPVCCIO_S0_CPU is a power rail responsible for powering the part of the CPU responsible for communicating with other portions of the machine prior to PPVCORE_S0_CPU being present and must be present before vcore, PPVCCIO_S0_CPU is present when the machine is in an on, RUNNING state. .
definitions.PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT is PPBUS_G3H backlight voltage entering the backlight boost circuit once the transistor has been told to allow it through. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
It's not starting up, But the fan is running, No chime, No display, or No backlight
Could someone please help me with the schematic and board view?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
I could find the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> schematic, As per this schematic and board file here is the voltage values 
All the readings are using the charger after disconnecting the battery connector. After disconnecting the battery it consumes a total 1.47Amp current at 19.7V.

L8410 - <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> - 0V
L7660 - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.324V
L7600 - <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> - 5.12V
L7900 - <SIGNAL>P1V2_PHASE</SIGNAL> - 1.205V
L7960 - <SIGNAL>PPVCCIO_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> - 0.978V
L8000 - <SIGNAL>PP1V_PCH_REG_R</SIGNAL> - 1.014V
L7030 - <SIGNAL>TBA_PHASE1</SIGNAL> -12.68V
L7410 - <SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL> - 0V
L7420 - <SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_CPU_PH2</SIGNAL> - 0V
L7211 - <SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL> - 1.045V
L7221 - <SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH2</SIGNAL>  - 0V
L7231 - <SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH3</SIGNAL>  - 1.047V
L7330 - <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_CPU_R</SIGNAL>  - 1.052V
LA640 - <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH2</SIGNAL> - 0.903V
LA650 - <SIGNAL>GFXIMVP_PHASE1</SIGNAL> -  0.903V
LA350 - <SIGNAL>VRVDDCI_R</SIGNAL>  - 0.902V

LA300 - PP1V5R1V35_GPU_REG_R - 1.349V 

LB700 - <SIGNAL>P5VUSBCT_R</SIGNAL> - 0V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
CPU core should drop from 1.05V to 0.6V aprox, when board really boots.
Did you try knwon good BIOS?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?
Any history fault available?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
I have removed the board, it is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, I could see some areas are a little dirty and a bit corroded. Please find the video attached. Does anybody have a schematic and board view for this particular model?

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1G3IAYy5MHZELmZ5BPY-4LleGXIGuQjGn?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
I could find the schematic and board file, Sharing it in the same google drive above. 
The corrosion is around  <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> (DDR4) , and <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
L7211/21/31 must all have the SAME voltage; check schematic.

Please reply the previous questions.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
When I test board separately ,  L7211/21/31   all these voltages stays 0V.
Same time  <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> stays HIGH (3.3V). CPU is heating UP (Heat is keep increasing)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
You've said 1V at L7211/31; which is actually state?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> shouldn't go high, if no CPU core voltage present.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message: L7211/31 was 1V when it was connected with the display. When I test board alone  L7211/31 are 0V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message: And you have high <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> in such case???

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
I have connected back to the enclosure, Measured <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>, It  is still going high (3.3V).
what does it mean?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
Means the CPU core voltage is there; which is the voltage after 10s?

Just in case, try known good BIOS.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message: The core voltage is 0.903V after 10 sec. Could you help me with a known working bios?
